alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson; Greater Greenville; Greenwood; Laurens; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 12:19AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elbert, Hart, Laurens, Anderson, Abbeville, Greenwood, southeastern Greenville, and southeastern Spartanburg Counties through 100 AM EST... At 1217 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Downtown Greenville to 5 miles east of Hartwell Georgia to 7 miles south of Danielsville Georgia. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elberton, Anderson, Fountain Inn, Belton, Honea Path, Ware Shoals, Calhoun Falls, Due West, Iva and Gray Court. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Abbeville; Anderson; Greater Greenville; Greenwood; Laurens; Spartanburg
